Sessions\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1 Session management \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1.1 An established secure mechanism must be implemented for session management (use session cookies in web applications if possible).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1.2 Session state management (validation, processing and storage of the session identifier, session state and session-related information) must be implemented on the server side and should be implemented in the same tier as the main business logic.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1.3 Logout functionality must be explicitly available at all times to authenticated users of the application.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1.4 Logging out must invalidate the session (delete the session state on the server) and explicitly destroy the session data.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1.5 Applications must invalidate the session after no longer than 15 minutes of inactivity. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1.6 All active sessions must be invalidated when the user amends authentication credentials. A typical scenario is: the user has web and mobile clients active simultaneously and changes the password using one of those clients.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.1.7 Session timeout should be a configurable system parameter. (Configurable only by personnel in appropriate roles (e.g. operational or system administration staff).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2 Session identifiers\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.1 Session identifiers must always be generated on the server side.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.2 The session identifier associated with a user must be verified upon each attempt to execute a discrete function of the business logic:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" Applications should verify validity of the session identifier (its size, type and content)\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" Applications should verify that the user associated with the session identifier is authorised to perform the function requested\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.3 Session identifiers must be at least 160 bits (20 characters) in length and should be at least 256 bits in length.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.4 Session identifiers must be unique within the session state mechanism at any point of time.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.5 Session identifiers must be generated using an algorithm based on a cryptographically secure random number generator.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.6 Session identifier must be re-generated after a successful user authentication:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" The old unauthenticated session (if it exists) must be terminated\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" A new session identifier, not related to the previously used unauthenticated one, must be generated\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.7 Session identifiers should not contain any plain text information related to any data about the user or the system infrastructure (including, but not limited to, IP Address, port, hostname,username, credit card number, password).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.8 Session identifiers must not be displayed to users via the generated content.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.9 Session identifiers should be encrypted when stored on the server.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.10 Access to the server-side store of session identifiers should be restricted on the server (it is usually appropriate to only grant this access to the account under which the application is running).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.11 Session identifiers used by web applications should be configured to expire when the browser is closed (which would normally be achieved by not setting the 'expiry' attribute for the respective cookie). For desktop, thick-client etc. applications as well as for mobile apps, closing the application should invalidate the session (delete the session state on the server) and destroy the session data.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.12 Session identifiers associated with an authenticated session should be transmitted over a secure channel:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" Applications should not use a session identifier generated during a non-secure session to identify the user\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" Applications should not use the same session identifier in authenticated and non-authenticated areas of application. Only session IDs generated during secure transmission may be used to identify a secure session. Applications should generate an additional session identifier as soon as the user accesses a secured area (e.g. the user accesses application content over HTTPS after an HTTP interaction)\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.13 Applications should not contain insecure elements within the secure context (e.g. HTTP links to images in a page served over HTTPS) to eliminate the possibility of transmitting the session identifier over insecure communication.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.2.14 The scope of session identifiers and access to them must be restricted as much as possible (e.g. by using cookie attributes – secure, HTTP only, domain, path). \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.3 Transaction flow\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.3.1 A unique token should be added to any request that causes modification of data in order to eliminate the possibility of “session riding” attacks (such as Cross-Site Request Forgery - CSRF). Anti-CSRF tokens should be valid for single use only and must be generated using a cryptographically secure pseudorandom number generator and validated before the action requested is executed.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.3.2 Transaction steps must be validated on the server side, and in the tier where the main business logic is implemented, to ensure that any pre-requisite steps have already been accomplished. The application must be aware of the current transaction state at any point of time, e.g. server-side completeness and correctness checks must be utilised for forms that have to be completed in sequence (deliver goods only if billing has been completed).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.3.3 Transactions must be rejected instantly upon detecting invalid steps or incorrect sequence.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"8.3.4 Sessions should be invalidated upon detecting invalid steps or incorrect sequence. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
